problemStatement.plain: There is no norm-multiplicative bilinear map R³ × R³ → R³. This is the n=3 case of Hurwitz's theorem, which states such maps exist only for n = 1, 2, 4, 8.
whyMatters: Explains why quaternions and octonions are special
